revised_title: Evolution of Floral Symmetry and Its Molecular Mechanisms
tldr: The authors investigate the genetic basis of floral symmetry in Antirrhinum, a plant species with irregular flowers. They describe mutations that affect the symmetry and discuss the evolution of irregular flowers. The study of genes controlling floral symmetry can help understand the molecular mechanisms underlying floral evolution and the role of genes like "cyc" in establishing asymmetry.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
